Detailed Description

Camera class that represents a view in 2d space.

The Camera class does little more than translate the render space when render is called. The Camera class inherits from Component, but a Camera can only ever be attached to one SceneNode at a time. The Camera class can listen to multiple RenderOriginators though, which means it can be used to render the main scene as well as multiple RenderTextures at the same time. Cameras are managed through the SceneManager's *Camera methods.

See also:
Component, RenderableListener and SceneManager::createCamera(std::string name)

const hgeVector Camera::convertToScreenSpace ( hgeVector  point  ) 

Special method used to convert a position into screen space.

Parameters:
point The point to convert.
Remarks:
Subclasses of Renderable need to call this to convert their positions into screen coordinates for rendering.

Definition at line 58 of file Camera.h.

void Camera::registerUser ( SceneNode *  node  )  [virtual]

Notifies the Camera that it has been attached to a SceneNode.

This method is overriden from the version defined in Component to allow for only one user at a time. This method is an internal method and should not be called directly.

Parameters:
node SceneNode the Camera has been attached to.

Reimplemented from Component.
